name: Christopher Columbus Memorial, (sculpture)
location_description: Columbus Park, Civic Center, in front of New York State Supreme Court Building, Brooklyn, New York
description: The figure of Columbus stands with his hand upon a ship's tiller. The base is a fluted column on a stepped octagonal base.

name: To Christopher Columbus
text: To Christopher Columbus. . The Italians resident in America,  scoffed at before,  during the voyage, menaced,  after it, chained,  as generous as oppressed,  to the world he gave a world.   Joy and Glory  Never utter a more thrilling call  Than that which resounded  From the conquered ocean  In sight of the first American island  Land! Land!    On the XII of October MDCCCXCII  The fourth centenary  Of the discovery of America  In imperishable remembrance.

name: 59th Street--Columbus Circle Subway Station (IRT)
location_description: Solow Building, 9 West 57th Street, Entrance, New York, New York 10019
description: A three-dimensional number nine made of 1/4 in. steel plate anchored to the sidewalk with two 1 ft. steel pins. The sculpture is painted a red-orange color. Two small cylinders (H. 1 1/2 in. Diam. 2 in.) of marble are set into the pavement beneath the nine on the north side. It appears that two additional cylinders may have once been set into the pavement on the south side, but are now missing.
notes: Save Outdoor Sculpture, New York, New York survey, 1992. | Image on file. | (On Fifth Avenue side, bottom center:) Chermayeff '72. signed | The information provided about this artwork was compiled as part of the Smithsonian American Art Museum's Inventories of American Painting and Sculpture database, designed to provide descriptive and location information on artworks by American artists in public and private collections worldwide.
